body_html:
Short answer to the seed request: it is unlikely this will be accepted, since TensorFlow's universal convention has been to use "initializers" instead of a simple seed. For example, see init_ops.py.

That said, we should perhaps document the default inits used in dense() docstring. @fchollet - mind taking a look?
body_text:
Short answer to the seed request: it is unlikely this will be accepted, since TensorFlow's universal convention has been to use "initializers" instead of a simple seed.  For example, see init_ops.py.
That said, we should perhaps document the default inits used in dense() docstring.  @fchollet - mind taking a look?
body:
Short answer to the seed request: it is unlikely this will be accepted, since TensorFlow's universal convention has been to use "initializers" instead of a simple seed.  For example, see [init_ops.py](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops.py).

That said, we should perhaps document the default inits used in `dense()` docstring.  @fchollet - mind taking a look?
